He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> == References == [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]'
revision.text:
Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References ==
[[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]

Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the IIC University of Technology, Cambodia, via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.
== References ==
[[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]

'''Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the IIC University of Technology, Cambodia, via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.
== References ==
[[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} '''Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the IIC University of Technology, Cambodia, via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.
== References ==
[[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} '''Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-18 |title=President Muizzu appoints Saeed as Economic Minister, Shafeeq as Finance Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/president-muizzu-appoints-saeed-as-economic-minister-shafeeq-as-finance-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref>
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the [[IIC University of Technology]], [[Cambodia]], via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.<ref>{{Cite web |last=frontpage.mv |title=President Dr. Muizzu Has Appointed the New Cabinet |url=https://www.frontpage.mv/news/detail/787 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=frontpage.mv |language=en}}</ref> == References ==
[[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Finance ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} '''Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-18 |title=President Muizzu appoints Saeed as Economic Minister, Shafeeq as Finance Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/president-muizzu-appoints-saeed-as-economic-minister-shafeeq-as-finance-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref>
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the [[IIC University of Technology]], [[Cambodia]], via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.<ref>{{Cite web |last=frontpage.mv |title=President Dr. Muizzu Has Appointed the New Cabinet |url=https://www.frontpage.mv/news/detail/787 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=frontpage.mv |language=en}}</ref> == References ==

revision.text:
{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq | image = Dr._Mohamed_Shafeeq_portrait.jpg | office = Finance Minister of the [[Maldives]] | party = [[People's National Congress (Maldives)]] | president = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | nationality = [[Maldives|Maldivian]] | term_start = 17 November 2023 | predecessor = }} '''Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-18 |title=President Muizzu appoints Saeed as Economic Minister, Shafeeq as Finance Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/president-muizzu-appoints-saeed-as-economic-minister-shafeeq-as-finance-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref>
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the [[IIC University of Technology]], [[Cambodia]], via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.<ref>{{Cite web |last=frontpage.mv |title=President Dr. Muizzu Has Appointed the New Cabinet |url=https://www.frontpage.mv/news/detail/787 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=frontpage.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== References ==

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Dr. Mohamed Shafeeq | image = Dr._Mohamed_Shafeeq_portrait.jpg | office = Finance Minister of the [[Maldives]] | party = [[People's National Congress (Maldives)]] | president = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | nationality = [[Maldives|Maldivian]] | term_start = 17 November 2023 | predecessor = }} '''Mohamed Shafeeq''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Finance Minister of the Maldives.<ref>web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> He was the Chief Financial Officer of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC). He joined the corporation in 2009, and was appointed to the post of CFO in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-18 |title=President Muizzu appoints Saeed as Economic Minister, Shafeeq as Finance Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/president-muizzu-appoints-saeed-as-economic-minister-shafeeq-as-finance-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref>
He completed his PhD in Business Administration from the [[IIC University of Technology]], [[Cambodia]], via the European Institute of Professional Education in Sri Lanka.<ref>{{Cite web |last=frontpage.mv |title=President Dr. Muizzu Has Appointed the New Cabinet |url=https://www.frontpage.mv/news/detail/787 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=frontpage.mv |language=en}}</ref>
